intro: Leonohebe, commonly known as the mountain hebe, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and dense foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple, depending on the species. Leonohebe thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine regions. Its adaptability to harsh environments makes it a hardy and resilient plant in its native habitat.
